alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Washington; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 11:01AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Milwaukee, Ozaukee, Washington and Waukesha. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1058 AM CDT, While the heavy rain has pushed east lingering urban and small stream flooding remains possible. Radar indicates between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen across the advisory area, with reports of 2 or more inches in spots. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Milwaukee, Wauwatosa, Brookfield, Menomonee Falls, West Bend, Mequon, Hartford, Whitefish Bay, Pewaukee, Brown Deer, Grafton, Cedarburg, Sussex, Hartland, Jackson, Fox Point, Slinger, Bayside, Thiensville and Germantown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
